provisions.title: Object
provisions.content: (1) The object of this Act is to impose an African Union Import Levy of zero point two percent on the value of eligible goods imported into the country from a country that is not a Member State of the African Union. The object of this Act is to impose an African Union Import Levy of zero point two percent on the value of eligible goods imported into the country from a country that is not a Member State of the African Union. (2) The Levy shall be used to The Levy shall be used to provide a reliable and predictable funding for the Continental Peace and Security Fund of the African Union; provide a reliable and predictable funding for the Continental Peace and Security Fund of the African Union; provide an equitable and predictable source of financing for the African Union; provide an equitable and predictable source of financing for the African Union; reduce dependency of the African Union on partner funds for the implementation of the Continental Development and Integration Programmes; and reduce dependency of the African Union on partner funds for the implementation of the Continental Development and Integration Programmes; and relieve the Government of pressure with respect to meeting national obligations for payment of assessed contribution to funding the African Union. relieve the Government of pressure with respect to meeting national obligations for payment of assessed contribution to funding the African Union.

provisions.title: Imposition of Levy on eligible imports
provisions.content: (1) There is imposed by this Act, an African Union Import Levy of zero point two percent of the value of eligible goods imported into the country, where the goods originated from a country that is not a Member State of the African Union. There is imposed by this Act, an African Union Import Levy of zero point two percent of the value of eligible goods imported into the country, where the goods originated from a country that is not a Member State of the African Union. (2) For purposes of subsection (1), the under listed goods are not eligible goods: For purposes of subsection (1), the under listed goods are not eligible goods: goods originating from a country or territory that is a Member State of the African Union, imported into the country for home consumption or re-export to a Member State of the African Union; goods originating from a country or territory that is a Member State of the African Union, imported into the country for home consumption or re-export to a Member State of the African Union; goods received as aid, gift or grant from goods received as aid, gift or grant from a State; or a State; or a legal entity constituted under a public law, that provides charitable works recognised as being part of the common good; a legal entity constituted under a public law, that provides charitable works recognised as being part of the common good; goods imported by enterprises before the commencement of this Act; and goods imported by enterprises before the commencement of this Act; and goods for which an African Union Import Levy has already been paid in a Member State of the African Union prior to their import into this country. goods for which an African Union Import Levy has already been paid in a Member State of the African Union prior to their import into this country. provisions.title: Authority to collect Levy
provisions.content: The Levy shall be collected by the Ghana Revenue Authority established under section 1 of the Ghana Revenue Authority Act, 2009 (Act 791). The Levy shall be collected by the Ghana Revenue Authority established under section 1 of the Ghana Revenue Authority Act, 2009 (Act 791).

provisions.title: Bank account for Levy collected
provisions.content: The Authority shall pay moneys collected as Levy into an account opened for that purpose by the Controller and Accountant-General. The Authority shall pay moneys collected as Levy into an account opened for that purpose by the Controller and Accountant-General.

provisions.title: Transfer of moneys to the African Union
provisions.content: (1) The Minister shall, on the advice of the Minister responsible for Foreign Affairs on the request of the African Union, authorise the transfer of moneys from the account referred to in section 4 to an account prescribed by the African Union. The Minister shall, on the advice of the Minister responsible for Foreign Affairs on the request of the African Union, authorise the transfer of moneys from the account referred to in section 4 to an account prescribed by the African Union. (2) The purpose of the transfer is to apply proceeds from the Levy solely for the settlement of the assessed contribution of Ghana to the African Union for the relevant financial year. provisions.title: Utilisation of surplus
provisions.content: (1) Where there is a surplus on the account referred to in section 4 after a full settlement of the assessed contribution, the Bank of Ghana shall, on the instructions of the Minister, retain the surplus and utilise the surplus as specified in subsection (2). provisions.title: Annual report
provisions.content: The Minister shall submit an annual report on the collection and utilisation of the levy to Parliament as part of the annual budget. The Minister shall submit an annual report on the collection and utilisation of the levy to Parliament as part of the annual budget.

provisions.title: Interpretation
provisions.content: In this Act, unless the context otherwise requires,“assessed contribution” means the contribution of Ghana to the African Union as detennined by the African Union each year;“Authority” means the Ghana Revenue Authority established under section 1 of the Ghana Revenue Authority Act, 2009 (Act 791);“deficit” means where the revenue collected from the Levy is less than the assessed contribution for the year;“home consumption” means consumption in the cuntry;“Levy” means the African Union Import Levy imposed under section 2;“Minister” means the Minister responsible for Finance; and"surplus" means where the revenue collected from the “Levy is more than the assessed contribution for the year.
